scene-title: Main Proof of the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
scene-visual: A step-by-step visual representation of the proof of the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
scene-narration: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus states that if a function f is continuous over the interval [a, b] and F is an antiderivative of f on [a, b], then the definite integral of f from a to b is equal to F(b) - F(a). This theorem essentially tells us that the process of differentiation and integration are reverse processes of each other.
